issue.title: [Python] Support for masked arrays in to/from numpy
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-3686](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3686). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Again, in this PR for vaex: <https://github.com/maartenbreddels/vaex/pull/116> I support masked arrays, it would be nice if this goes into pyarrow. If this approach looks good I could do a PR.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3686?focusedCommentId=16762839) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
We have a `mask` argument to `pyarrow.array` already. It would seem reasonable to detect `ma.MaskedArray` and grab its mask

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3686?focusedCommentId=16792682) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Patches welcome. I'm moving this to 0.14 in the meantime

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3686?focusedCommentId=16864314) by Francois Saint-Jacques (fsaintjacques):*
